intro: Urechites neriandrus, commonly known as the black nightshade, is a flowering plant in the nightshade family (Solanaceae). It is characterized by its small, dark purple to black berries that are typically toxic to humans and animals. The plant has simple, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture and produces small white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in gardens, fields, and along roadsides. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to avoid ingestion of any part of the plant.
